chapter.title: VCov: a coverage testing tool
chapter.para: VCov is a coverage testing tool. It works quite like gcov, but has the big advantage that you don't have to recompile your program in order to use it.

listitem.para: Different kinds: line vs branch/decision vs path. "Code Coverage Analysis" by Steve Cornett is a good explanation of these basic kinds and other kinds (http://www.bullseye.com/coverage.html).
Stuff about debug info, compiling without optimisation
Gives instruction execution counts, not line execution counts. Implications of this, inaccuracies.
